metadata.title: CVE-2017-14051 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An integer overflow in the qla2x00_sysfs_write_optrom_ctl function indrivers/scsi/qla2xxx/qla_attr.c in the Linux kernel through 4.12.10 allowslocal users to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and systemcrash) by leveraging root access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14051` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.13.0-1005-raspi2 - 4.13.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1002-azure - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1001-gcp - 4.15.0-1001.1

No subscription required
